page.title: 16PLAYING FIELDS DOWNDERRY
page.content: THERE ARE NO FORMAL PLAYGROUNDS FOR THE CHILDREN.IN THE PAST OPEN FIELDS, TO THE NORTH,AND THE SEA,TO THE SOUTH HAVE BEEN CONSIDERED ADEQUATE.THE NEW AND GROWING POPULATION HAVE DIFFERENT NEEDS BUT THE OPTIONS ARE LIMITED.THE SCHOOL FIELD CANNOT WITHSTAND FURTHER USEAGE AND OTHER CLIFFTOP FLAT LAND, HAS BECOME HOUSE SITES.THE PRESENT STRUCTURE PLAN LIMITS EXTENSION OF VILLAGES WHERE EMPLOYMENT IS DIFFICULT.THUS THE REMAINING GREEN FIELD SITES BY THE VILLAGE WILL NOT EASILY OBTAIN FURTHER DEVELOPMENT PERMISSION. IT MAY SOON BE POSSIBLE TO OBTAIN A VILLAGE GREEN,A TRADITIONAL RURAL AMENITY NEGLECTED IN THE RAPID EXPANSION OF DOWNDERRY.PLANS ARE IN PREPARATION TO IMPROVE THE APPEARANCE OF THE VILLAGE CENTRE BY SYMPATHETIC BUILDING,PLANTING AND SOCIAL MANAGEMENT.
